newsitem.title: USA: National Car hit with discrimination suit.
newsitem.headline: National Car hit with discrimination suit.

text.p: A lawsuit has been filed against National Car Rental, a unit of Republic Industries Inc, on June 27 in the U.S. Southern District Court in Florida by 10 employees for alleged racial discrimination in the workplace.
The complaint alleges that National engages in racist conduct, racial remarks, discriminatory hiring practices, harassment, intimidation and retaliation against black employees.
The 10 employees who filed the suit are seeking class action status for all blacks employed or who sought employment by National within the state of Florida.
Attorney's for the plaintiffs were not immediately available to comment on the lawsuit.
A spokesperson for National Car has acknowledged the lawsuit, but has no comment about it.
National Car Rental provides passenger car rental service through a nationwide network of car rental stations.
